git_workflow_protocol.name: Git Workflow Protocol
git_workflow_protocol.summary: Defines the standard operating procedures for Git usage.

rules.name: Commit Process
rules.description: All Git commits must be executed through the `dspy_commit` module to ensure consistency, safety, and proper agent attribution.

rules.name: Nested Repository Handling
rules.description: This repository acts as a 'meta-repo' and contains other, separate Git repositories within its directory structure. These nested repositories are ignored by this parent repository's .gitignore file.
rules.rule: The agent must not attempt to stage or commit changes to files within these nested repositories from the parent repository. All Git operations for a nested repository must be performed from within that nested repository's own directory.
